programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Chandler upsets Anne Merrick's daughter by going to the funeral and Meadows takes the opportunity to lean hard on the superintendent's unstable brother James for his version of the rape story. Best discovers physical abuse is going on in his own family, Drummond and Sharpe team up to solve a violent robbery case and a seemingly petty incident of disorderly behaviour unexpectedly throws up a new lead in the hunt for the serial killer.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Janine admits her true feelings with devastating results.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Tom is a worried man as the club relaunches. Natalie shocks Ricky, and there's another bombshell in store for Lisa.

programme.title: Howards' Way
programme.desc: Tom and Emma tell Jack about their intention to accept Charles' offer, while Polly and Gerald fall out over their business plans.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The antiques dealer acquires a broken clock that holds the key to the honour of a family and a regiment thanks to some love letters from the Napoleonic era discovered inside. Ian McShane stars.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Jack feels increasingly disillusioned with life in Cardale and goes to set up a new clinic in Africa, where medical resources are scarce. Beth wishes him well, but finds herself hard-pressed to cope at the Beeches in his absence _ and doesn't respond to an emergency call until it's almost too late. With Amanda Burton and Kevin Whately.

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Gordon finds a baby, and Carole's ex-husband pays a visit.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth is waiting for a new three-piece suite to be delivered, boasting it is an exact replica of the one at Sandringham House - and goes to extraordinary lengths to ensure her neighbours see the royal warrant on the delivery van. But, as ever, her family contrives to take the gloss off her moment of glory. Comedy, starring Patricia Routledge.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Day of the Welsh Ferret
programme.desc: Compo has an interesting experience when he loses his ferret as the trio make their way to a friend's funeral.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: When the Teesdales stop to give Clegg, Compo and Seymour a lift home from their caravanning holiday, Mrs T tries to fight off a feeling of discomfort as it becomes apparent the trio are determined to help park the caravan in their drive. Peter Sallis stars.

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: It is the Great Slaughter giant marrow contest, but before the judging can commence, a gruesome discovery is made in Edie's allotment in the form of human bones.

programme.title: Strike
programme.desc: Part two of two. Strike goes in search of a murder suspect in several London's strip clubs, but a furious Wardle warns him not to interfere in police business. Robin's relationship hits an all-time low as she considers whether she wants to go through with getting married, while her mother urges her to consider her priorities. She comes to Matthew's aid when the killer sends him a severed thumb, but recklessly turns to Shanker for help behind Strike's back, urging him to take her to a suspect's home.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: An armoured security van is discovered at the bottom of a lake, and the team makes a link to a disappearance 17 years previously and an unsolved killing, prompting them to reopen the case. Sandra feels she is making progress after finding the murder weapon, but suffers a setback when a key witness is killed. Detective drama, starring Amanda Redman.

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Self-confessed nerd Lachlan strikes gold when he sits down to eat with psychologist Rachel - who turns out to be an avid Star Wars fan. Nanny and part-time weightlifter Lucy hopes to pick up a new partner in the restaurant - and it seems as though charity administrator Caroline may be the one for her - while Alistair, who at 5ft 7 worries about his height, meets magazine editor Emily. Will he be talking tall after their date?.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows from November 2020 including My Next Guest Needs No Introduction with David Letterman and Kim Kardashian, Borat Subsequent Moviefilm, Strictly Come Dancing, Don't Rock the Boat and The Undoing. They also watch the Good Morning Britain interview with Nigel Farage and BBC News coverage of Covid-19, the English lockdown and the death of Sean Connery.

programme.title: Married at First Sight Australia
programme.desc: Sandy, who has grown up in a traditional Indian family where the community can be involved when making life decisions, is matched with business owner and father Dan.

programme.title: Celebrity SAS: Who Dares Wins USA
programme.desc: Famous faces undergo special forces training. Tonight, the contestants are tested to their limits to find out what their weaknesses are.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny gets more than she bargained for when Leonard agrees to meet a psychiatrist on her behalf, while Sheldon and Raj collaborate on an astronomical discovery. Stuart moves out, but Howard and Bernadette's happiness is short-lived. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco star.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Beverly and Adam team up to do a mother-son cooking show on public access television. Meanwhile, when Barry ruins the one college letter of recommendation he is able to get, Murray must step in to help.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Adam is thrilled when he is asked to design his own video game for a school project. Beverly is worried about the extent of Pops' gambling, so ropes Bill Lewis into her latest scheme.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Mercedes holds an intervention for two warring friends. Meanwhile, a plea hearing prompts true feelings to rise to the surface.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Sienna, Ethan and Warren clash over parenting. Later, Romeo accuses Rayne of sleeping with his best friend, but soon realises that he has got the wrong end of the stick.

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Part two of two. Gordon Ramsay continues to uncover problems at the Juniper Hill Inn in Windsor, Vermont. The chef tries to help the staff communicate with owners Robert and Ari, but after he catches one of them telling a shocking lie, will it be the final straw?.

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in to the River Rock Inn in Milford, Pennsylvania, where owner Ken Pisciotta is struggling to attract guests and battling huge debts. He has all but given up and his constant negativity is rubbing off on the staff. Can Gordon get this establishment back on track before Ken loses everything?.

programme.title: Married at First Sight Australia
programme.desc: Sandy, who has grown up in a traditional Indian family where the community can be involved when making life decisions, is matched with business owner and father Dan.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The guys' science skills are put to the test when they get a flat tyre during Leonard's surprise bachelor party weekend in Mexico. Meanwhile, the girls finally force Penny to break the news to her family that she has eloped with Leonard. Keith Carradine guest stars.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Dinner reservations have been secured at a plush restaurant, but Gloria is taking forever to get ready and an almighty sartorial crisis strikes when Mitch and Cam don the exact same outfit. Meanwhile, the Dunphys can't decide whether Luke is trustworthy enough to be left home alone. Starring Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Manny is not happy when Gloria hires a male nanny and it turns out Jay isn't that keen either. Phil is worried about his dad Frank, and embarks on a mission to help him get his groove back, while Pepper pops by to plan Mitch and Cam's wedding, but when talk turns to unicorns, the pair attempt to rein their pal in. Nathan Lane guest stars.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The precinct's staff prepare for an unusually busy night as the neighbourhood gets into the Halloween spirit, and Amy falls into a particularly foul mood when she is forced to wear a fancy-dress costume during an undercover operation. Meanwhile, Jake bets Captain Holt that he can steal his Medal of Valour before midnight - a challenge that prompts him to don his own selection of disguises.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Jake makes an arrest without much proof, and so has to spend the next 48 hours collecting enough evidence to keep his suspect in custody. While his co-workers are forced to help him out over the weekend, Charles judges a pie contest between Rosa and Gina, and the Captain gives advice to Terry, who has a problem involving his brother-in-law. Comedy, starring Andy Samberg.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: In the last-ever episode of the US sitcom, there's an end and a beginning as the gang travel together into an uncharted future. Howard and Bernadette go away on a trip without their children for the first time, Leonard and Penny try to keep a secret, Sheldon and Amy stick together, and Raj makes a new friend.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Pilot episode of the comedy about scientists and their friendship with a down-to-earth neighbour. When aspiring actress Penny moves into Leonard's apartment block, he is immediately smitten, but Sheldon warns him that he runs the risk of a broken heart if he tries to woo her. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco star.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny gets more than she bargained for when Leonard agrees to meet a psychiatrist on her behalf, while Sheldon and Raj collaborate on an astronomical discovery. Stuart moves out, but Howard and Bernadette's happiness is short-lived. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco star.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: After being forced to deal with a sick Sheldon, the rest of the gang try to treat themselves to a Sheldon-free weekend. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay is troubled when best pal Shorty reveals that he and his wife are moving away. Phil and Claire take Haley out to discuss her future, while Mitchell and Cam take a break from all the wedding planning to enjoy a romantic meal - only to interrupt a couple's surprise engagement dinner. Chazz Palminteri and Jennifer Tilly guest star.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire thinks Luke is up to no good with his friends, so she persuades a reluctant Phil into helping her spy on their son. Gloria is suspicious of Jay when he starts moaning amorously in his sleep and Mitch struggles to keep a secret from Cam.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Holt invites the entire squad to his house to celebrate his birthday, but Jeffords struggles to keep everyone in line, with Peralta and Santiago making a bad impression on their host's husband Kevin. Meanwhile, Boyle's love of food leads to a romantic connection with an older woman, and Diaz introduces Gina to some psychologists - who find her to be a fascinating subject.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Boyle's new girlfriend gives his self-confidence a boost, but Peralta is forced to intervene before his colleague gets too serious, too soon in the relationship. Meanwhile, Diaz and Santiago have trouble taking a costumed crimefighter seriously, and Holt faces a challenge to his leadership.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard's purchase of a dining-room table causes Sheldon to re-evaluate his life. Meanwhile, Howard is offered the chance to go back to the International Space Station, and Bernadette struggles to decide whether to encourage him. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Melissa Rauch.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: After arguing with Sheldon, Howard tries to make amends by taking him to Nasa's headquarters in Houston. Elsewhere, Penny has second thoughts about quitting her job as a waitress when her car dies, while Amy tries to find Raj a date. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Leonard invent excuses to avoid having to attend Penny's performance in a production of the stage musical Rent, but maintaining the pretence makes matters increasingly complicated. Johnny Galecki, Simon Helberg and Kaley Cuoco star, with DJ Qualls.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon falls ill, and his friends decide to go to a Planet of the Apes movie marathon to keep their distance, knowing he will be in a terrible mood. However, an unsuspecting Penny offers to nurse him. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Simon Helberg and Kaley Cuoco.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Imran confides in Brooke, as the pair reminisce over the past. Meanwhile, a determined Romeo turns to Lacey for help in getting Rayne back.

programme.title: Married at First Sight Australia
programme.desc: Tahnee and Ollie meet for the first time at the altar, and despite being the youngest couple in this year's experiment, both are old souls with traditional views of relationships.

programme.title: Celebrity SAS: Who Dares Wins USA
programme.desc: The recruits face an emergency escape drill, and tensions rise as the they face each other over disagreements and the pressure becomes too much to handle for some.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, with cameras capturing their instant reactions and the lively discussions that are prompted by the week's biggest and best shows. Programmes this time include A Nightmare on Elm Street 3: Dream Warriors, Sex, Love & Goop, Coronation Street, Strictly Come Dancing, The Cube, Celebrity Ghost Trip, Dom Delivers, and This Morning. Narrated by Craig Cash.

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 19-year-old student Marlie from Yorkshire, who keeps choosing the bad boys - which is driving her mum mad. There's also 30-year-old Adam, from Bradford. Having previously had his heart broken, he is now looking for a woman with no secrets, and believes that if the contestants are willing to bare all on TV, they probably have nothing to hide.

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Twenty-one-year-old Dom from Hampshire has been nominated for the show by his mum, in a desperate attempt to break his dismal dating record. Dom wants to find a partner who shares his love of adventure and isn't bothered by his posh boy charm. There's also 22-year-old pansexual Izzy, who is open to dating any gender, but with so much on offer, will she make the right choice?.

programme.title: Wipeout USA
programme.desc: Thrill-seeking contestants compete on the world's largest obstacle course, which includes Donut Run, Crazy Beams, Pole Vault, the Toothbrush Sweeper and Launch Pads among its extreme challenges.

programme.title: Rude Tube
programme.desc: Alex Zane presents 50 of the internet's most entertaining stunts, featuring daredevil base-jumping from a moving lorry and other don't-try-this-at-home feats, to hammock-spinning in Redcar and no-holds-barred action captured on headcams.

programme.title: Only the Biggest Hits
programme.desc: Turn up the volume on your TV! We're about to play only the biggest hits from some of your favourite music stars!.

programme.title: Only the Biggest Hits
programme.desc: Turn up the volume on your TV! We're about to play only the biggest hits from some of your favourite music stars!.

programme.title: Happy International Women's Day!
programme.desc: We're celebrating with a non-stop playlist full of our favourite female music stars!.

programme.title: Power Up! All Girl Anthems
programme.desc: Join Swarzy Macaly as she celebrates some of the most powerful women in music via an epic playlist of all girl anthems!.

programme.title: Fresh Off the Boat
programme.desc: Eddie learns that his secret admirer is Trent's sister Tina, and his friend warns him to stay away from her - not for her protection but for Eddie's.

programme.title: Fresh Off the Boat
programme.sub-title: These Boots Are Made for Walkin'
programme.desc: Emery starts skipping his volleyball practice, prompting Louis and Evan to investigate. Louis then discovers Emery taking up line dancing in a bar.

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Part one of two. While Piper and Phoebe mourn the death of Prue, the Source uncovers the identity of a woman who can restore the Power of Three and renew the sisters' strength as witches.

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Part two of two. While Piper and Phoebe continue to grieve over the loss of Prue, the Source plots to stop Paige restoring the sisters' strength as witches by luring her over to the dark side.

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Ben panics when he realises he has forgotten his mother's birthday yet again, so he enlists an unwilling Danny, Tucker and Riley to organise a celebration in a hurry. However, when Danny learns something unexpected about his own birthday, Bonnie's party gains new significance. Emma hurts herself on Riley and Tucker's watch and they tie themselves in knots trying to hide her injury. Comedy, starring Jean-Luc Bilodeau.

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.sub-title: You Give Real Estate a Bad Name
programme.desc: Bonnie is elated when she has a chance of being appointed as the real-estate agent responsible for a celebrity penthouse sale. However, she later discovers she's competing with her former boyfriend Brad for the job. Danny is happily dating his new girlfriend Robyn, but is disturbed to realise that she seems to have more in common with Ben.

programme.title: Wife Swap USA
programme.desc: The subservient wife of a biker who believes men should be waited on hand-and-foot swaps lives with a progressive social media influencer, whose husband takes care of the kids.

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Recording artist Darius Rucker goes undercover to find America's next great musical act. Darius first gained fame as lead vocalist and rhythm guitarist of rock band Hootie & the Blowfish, selling over 16 million records and winning two Grammys. He then went on to have a successful solo career as a county music artist. Now Darius wants to find talented but undiscovered new music acts and help launch their careers, so dons a disguise to work at an open mic night, as a roadie and a busker in his efforts to locate fresh songwriting and performing talent.

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Chef and restaurateur Marcus Samuelsson goes undercover to find and mentor America's next great chef. An Ethiopian refugee adopted by a Swedish family, Marcus developed a deep love for cooking at an early age and has since become a renowned force in international cuisine, with over 30 restaurants worldwide. Marcus disguises himself to work incognito in a teaching kitchen, a food truck business, a culinary institute and a soup kitchen, as he searches for undiscovered chefs to mentor.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay tries to help a struggling seafood restaurant in Manhattan, where the three owners regularly come into conflict as they each try to assert their authority over the business, causing confusion for all. When one of the trio stubbornly resists the changes the Scottish chef is hoping to implement, sparks begin to fly.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef takes on one of his toughest challenges yet, J Willy's Bar and Grille in South Bend, Indiana, which has amassed debts of more than $1million. On finding an inexperienced chef serving food from both the freezer and tins, together with service that reduces one customer to tears, Gordon Ramsay orders an overnight deep-clean of the premises and designs a menu to inspire the kitchen staff.

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Riley realises she has to tell Danny she has feelings for him before his relationship with Robyn gets more serious. Tucker is unhappy with his love life, so Ben and Bonnie invent a secret admirer to give him some much needed confidence. However, the plot goes awry when they use a random photo of a model and Tucker encounters her by chance in the street.

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.sub-title: Home Is Where the Wheeler Is
programme.desc: Riley cannot face the mess she has made out of her relationships with Ben and Danny, so she runs home to her mother's house in New Jersey to hide from her problems. When her next door neighbour Evelyn dies, Bonnie plots for the chance to sell her apartment.

programme.title: Malcolm in the Middle
programme.desc: Grandma Ida (Cloris Leachman) announces she is getting married to a rich Chinese man she met on a cruise - but the family is not convinced her intentions toward her fiance are honourable. Meanwhile, Malcolm tries to hide his tongue piercing from his parents.

programme.title: Malcolm in the Middle
programme.desc: Malcolm joins the Lucky Aide softball team, unaware Lois is the coach. Reese tries to beat Francis's record of collecting toilet seats from a junkyard, while Hal mistakenly applies to join the CIA. Starring Frankie Muniz and Jane Kaczmarek.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Sheldon receive an invitation to present their research to a physics conference, but Sheldon's reluctance to pander to his peers causes conflict between the friends. An intervention by Penny makes matters worse. Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons star.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Leonard invent excuses to avoid having to attend Penny's performance in a production of the stage musical Rent, but maintaining the pretence makes matters increasingly complicated. Johnny Galecki, Simon Helberg and Kaley Cuoco star, with DJ Qualls.

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the words-and-numbers quiz, with regular Sean Lock and guest captain Sarah Millican joined by Bob Mortimer and Katherine Ryan. Alex Horne and the Horne Section preside alongside Countdown regular Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley provides the letters and numbers.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Asim Chaudhry plays snooker with drainpipes, Tim Vine gets stuck in a tunnel and Greg Davies gives Alex Horne a sharp telling off in front of everyone.

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Guests Micky Flanagan, Mel Giedroyc, Stephen Graham and Katherine Ryan join team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson to uncover the public's most popular talking points, answering questions based on opinion polls carried out around the country. Jimmy Carr hosts the irreverent panel show.

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the words-and-numbers quiz, with regular Sean Lock and guest captain Sarah Millican joined by Bob Mortimer and Katherine Ryan. Alex Horne and the Horne Section preside alongside Countdown regular Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley provides the letters and numbers.

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Self-confessed nerd Lachlan strikes gold when he sits down to eat with psychologist Rachel - who turns out to be an avid Star Wars fan. Nanny and part-time weightlifter Lucy hopes to pick up a new partner in the restaurant - and it seems as though charity administrator Caroline may be the one for her - while Alistair, who at 5ft 7 worries about his height, meets magazine editor Emily. Will he be talking tall after their date?.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows from November 2020 including My Next Guest Needs No Introduction with David Letterman and Kim Kardashian, Borat Subsequent Moviefilm, Strictly Come Dancing, Don't Rock the Boat and The Undoing. They also watch the Good Morning Britain interview with Nigel Farage and BBC News coverage of Covid-19, the English lockdown and the death of Sean Connery.

programme.title: Married at First Sight Australia
programme.desc: Sandy, who has grown up in a traditional Indian family where the community can be involved when making life decisions, is matched with business owner and father Dan.

programme.title: Celebrity SAS: Who Dares Wins USA
programme.desc: Famous faces undergo special forces training. Tonight, the contestants are tested to their limits to find out what their weaknesses are.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny gets more than she bargained for when Leonard agrees to meet a psychiatrist on her behalf, while Sheldon and Raj collaborate on an astronomical discovery. Stuart moves out, but Howard and Bernadette's happiness is short-lived. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco star.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Beverly and Adam team up to do a mother-son cooking show on public access television. Meanwhile, when Barry ruins the one college letter of recommendation he is able to get, Murray must step in to help.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Adam is thrilled when he is asked to design his own video game for a school project. Beverly is worried about the extent of Pops' gambling, so ropes Bill Lewis into her latest scheme.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Mercedes holds an intervention for two warring friends. Meanwhile, a plea hearing prompts true feelings to rise to the surface.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Sienna, Ethan and Warren clash over parenting. Later, Romeo accuses Rayne of sleeping with his best friend, but soon realises that he has got the wrong end of the stick.

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Part two of two. Gordon Ramsay continues to uncover problems at the Juniper Hill Inn in Windsor, Vermont. The chef tries to help the staff communicate with owners Robert and Ari, but after he catches one of them telling a shocking lie, will it be the final straw?.

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in to the River Rock Inn in Milford, Pennsylvania, where owner Ken Pisciotta is struggling to attract guests and battling huge debts. He has all but given up and his constant negativity is rubbing off on the staff. Can Gordon get this establishment back on track before Ken loses everything?.

programme.title: Married at First Sight Australia
programme.desc: Sandy, who has grown up in a traditional Indian family where the community can be involved when making life decisions, is matched with business owner and father Dan.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The guys' science skills are put to the test when they get a flat tyre during Leonard's surprise bachelor party weekend in Mexico. Meanwhile, the girls finally force Penny to break the news to her family that she has eloped with Leonard. Keith Carradine guest stars.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Dinner reservations have been secured at a plush restaurant, but Gloria is taking forever to get ready and an almighty sartorial crisis strikes when Mitch and Cam don the exact same outfit. Meanwhile, the Dunphys can't decide whether Luke is trustworthy enough to be left home alone. Starring Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Manny is not happy when Gloria hires a male nanny and it turns out Jay isn't that keen either. Phil is worried about his dad Frank, and embarks on a mission to help him get his groove back, while Pepper pops by to plan Mitch and Cam's wedding, but when talk turns to unicorns, the pair attempt to rein their pal in. Nathan Lane guest stars.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The precinct's staff prepare for an unusually busy night as the neighbourhood gets into the Halloween spirit, and Amy falls into a particularly foul mood when she is forced to wear a fancy-dress costume during an undercover operation. Meanwhile, Jake bets Captain Holt that he can steal his Medal of Valour before midnight - a challenge that prompts him to don his own selection of disguises.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Jake makes an arrest without much proof, and so has to spend the next 48 hours collecting enough evidence to keep his suspect in custody. While his co-workers are forced to help him out over the weekend, Charles judges a pie contest between Rosa and Gina, and the Captain gives advice to Terry, who has a problem involving his brother-in-law. Comedy, starring Andy Samberg.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: In the last-ever episode of the US sitcom, there's an end and a beginning as the gang travel together into an uncharted future. Howard and Bernadette go away on a trip without their children for the first time, Leonard and Penny try to keep a secret, Sheldon and Amy stick together, and Raj makes a new friend.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Pilot episode of the comedy about scientists and their friendship with a down-to-earth neighbour. When aspiring actress Penny moves into Leonard's apartment block, he is immediately smitten, but Sheldon warns him that he runs the risk of a broken heart if he tries to woo her. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco star.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny gets more than she bargained for when Leonard agrees to meet a psychiatrist on her behalf, while Sheldon and Raj collaborate on an astronomical discovery. Stuart moves out, but Howard and Bernadette's happiness is short-lived. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco star.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: After being forced to deal with a sick Sheldon, the rest of the gang try to treat themselves to a Sheldon-free weekend. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay is troubled when best pal Shorty reveals that he and his wife are moving away. Phil and Claire take Haley out to discuss her future, while Mitchell and Cam take a break from all the wedding planning to enjoy a romantic meal - only to interrupt a couple's surprise engagement dinner. Chazz Palminteri and Jennifer Tilly guest star.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire thinks Luke is up to no good with his friends, so she persuades a reluctant Phil into helping her spy on their son. Gloria is suspicious of Jay when he starts moaning amorously in his sleep and Mitch struggles to keep a secret from Cam.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Holt invites the entire squad to his house to celebrate his birthday, but Jeffords struggles to keep everyone in line, with Peralta and Santiago making a bad impression on their host's husband Kevin. Meanwhile, Boyle's love of food leads to a romantic connection with an older woman, and Diaz introduces Gina to some psychologists - who find her to be a fascinating subject.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Boyle's new girlfriend gives his self-confidence a boost, but Peralta is forced to intervene before his colleague gets too serious, too soon in the relationship. Meanwhile, Diaz and Santiago have trouble taking a costumed crimefighter seriously, and Holt faces a challenge to his leadership.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard's purchase of a dining-room table causes Sheldon to re-evaluate his life. Meanwhile, Howard is offered the chance to go back to the International Space Station, and Bernadette struggles to decide whether to encourage him. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Melissa Rauch.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: After arguing with Sheldon, Howard tries to make amends by taking him to Nasa's headquarters in Houston. Elsewhere, Penny has second thoughts about quitting her job as a waitress when her car dies, while Amy tries to find Raj a date. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Leonard invent excuses to avoid having to attend Penny's performance in a production of the stage musical Rent, but maintaining the pretence makes matters increasingly complicated. Johnny Galecki, Simon Helberg and Kaley Cuoco star, with DJ Qualls.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon falls ill, and his friends decide to go to a Planet of the Apes movie marathon to keep their distance, knowing he will be in a terrible mood. However, an unsuspecting Penny offers to nurse him. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Simon Helberg and Kaley Cuoco.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Imran confides in Brooke, as the pair reminisce over the past. Meanwhile, a determined Romeo turns to Lacey for help in getting Rayne back.

programme.title: Married at First Sight Australia
programme.desc: Tahnee and Ollie meet for the first time at the altar, and despite being the youngest couple in this year's experiment, both are old souls with traditional views of relationships.

programme.title: Celebrity SAS: Who Dares Wins USA
programme.desc: The recruits face an emergency escape drill, and tensions rise as the they face each other over disagreements and the pressure becomes too much to handle for some.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, with cameras capturing their instant reactions and the lively discussions that are prompted by the week's biggest and best shows. Programmes this time include A Nightmare on Elm Street 3: Dream Warriors, Sex, Love & Goop, Coronation Street, Strictly Come Dancing, The Cube, Celebrity Ghost Trip, Dom Delivers, and This Morning. Narrated by Craig Cash.

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 19-year-old student Marlie from Yorkshire, who keeps choosing the bad boys - which is driving her mum mad. There's also 30-year-old Adam, from Bradford. Having previously had his heart broken, he is now looking for a woman with no secrets, and believes that if the contestants are willing to bare all on TV, they probably have nothing to hide.

programme.title: News
programme.desc: The leading news stories of the moment.

programme.title: Born on the Fourth of July (1989)
programme.desc: Oliver Stone's fact-based drama chronicles the life of Ron Kovic, an eager-to-impress, patriotic Marine Corps recruit, who endures terrifying experiences during the Vietnam conflict that leave him paralysed from the chest down. On his return home, he undergoes a harrowing journey of physical and mental recovery that leads him to question the whole purpose of the war. Starring Tom Cruise, Willem Dafoe, Kyra Sedgwick and Josh Evans.

programme.title: A Town Like Alice (1956)
programme.desc: Second World War PoW Jean Paget is sent on a gruelling forced march between Japanese labour camps, but finds comfort in her friendship with Australian captive Joe Harman. During the journey Joe is caught stealing, tied to a cross and left to die. After the conflict is over, Jean is startled to receive a letter postmarked in Joe's home town of Alice Springs. Jack Lee's drama, based on the novel by Nevil Shute, starring Virginia McKenna, Peter Finch, Takagi and Jean Anderson.

programme.title: The Furies (1950)
programme.desc: The daughter of a ruthlessly ambitious cattle baron is divided between her love for one of his enemies and the prospect of taking over the family ranch when he dies. But when the cruel rancher has one of her friends hanged, she begins plotting his downfall. Western from director Anthony Mann, starring Barbara Stanwyck and Walter Huston.

programme.title: Ice Cold in Alex (1958)
programme.desc: The crew and passengers of an ambulance become stranded in the Libyan desert and face a perilous journey back to civilisation. Leading the trek is an alcoholic army captain, who vows to remain sober until he has completed the task - but his resolve is threatened by a stranger they rescue who is secretly an enemy spy. Second World War drama, with John Mills, Sylvia Syms, Anthony Quayle and Harry Andrews.

programme.title: Little Women (2019)
programme.desc: In 1868, New York City teacher Jo March goes to Mr Dashwood, an editor who agrees to publish a story she has written. She reflects back and forth on her life, telling the story of the March sisters - four young women, each determined to live life on her own terms. Writer/director Greta Gerwig's adaptation of the Louisa May Alcott novel, starring Saoirse Ronan, Emma Watson and Florence Pugh.

programme.title: Proxima (2019)
programme.desc: A French engineer sets out on a year-long space mission as her daughter grapples with her impending absence. Drama, starring Eva Green, Zélie Boulant-Lemesle and Matt Dillon.

programme.title: Amulet (2020)
programme.desc: A homeless ex-soldier is offered a place to stay at a decaying house inhabited by a young woman and her dying mother. The smitten former trooper soon suspects something sinister is going on. Writer/director Romola Garai's horror, starring Carla Juri, Alec Secareanu, and Imelda Staunton.

programme.title: Guy's Grocery Games
programme.desc: Guy Fieri welcomes four competition-winning chefs to compete. After a dual one-on-one pork dish battle, the final two chefs face off to see who wins $15,000

programme.title: Restaurant: Impossible
programme.desc: Chef Robert Irvine faces the challenge of saving struggling restaurants in two days, with a budget of $10,000. This time, he heads to a family restaurant in Kansas City, Missouri.

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.sub-title: River Cottage: Winter's on the Way
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall deals with a rabbit invasion in his garden by bringing in two warreners, and takes his children to Devon to look for wild mussels with French teacher Nathalie Arnold and her family. He also meets a London man who makes wine in his back yard, explores the qualities of hemp, and receives help from his local Women's Institute to get rabbits back on the British menu.

programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Trisha's Southern Kitchen
programme.desc: Trisha travels to a friend's flower truck to brighten up her kitchen. She then cooks up a spring feast which includes spring veggies with sweet pea aioli.

programme.title: Trisha's Southern Kitchen
programme.desc: Trisha and her husband, Garth, finally wrap up their tour after three years on the road. She then cooks up country turnip greens and beef brisket for her tour mates.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: The Drummonds celebrate the completion of their new office with a shrimp cocktail bar with three sauces, plus spicy Italian meatballs, bacon wrapped dates and sweet brownie pops.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond prepares brunch for three generations of Drummond girls, including maple oat nut scones, a cowgirl quiche, and champagne oranges.

programme.title: Delicious Miss Brown
programme.desc: Kardea makes updated versions of favourite foods from her childhood. They include yummy double berry snack bars and mini golden beef pockets.

programme.title: Delicious Miss Brown
programme.desc: Kardea treats her mum and aunt to a spa day followed by a decadent dinner. She makes creamy lobster and corn pappardelle and chocolate martinis.

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.sub-title: Green Tea Salmon and Modern Greek Salad
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates how to prepare green tea salmon, coconut rice and miso greens, as well as modern Greek salad with spinach, chickpea and feta parcels, all within the space of 15 minutes.

programme.title: Jamie's 30 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver presents a step-by-step guide to preparing jerk chicken with rice and beans, chopped salad and chargrilled corn, all in half an hour.

programme.title: Tom Kerridge's American Feast
programme.desc: Tom Kerridge travels across the US discovering the heart and soul of American food. The Michelin-starred chef samples the nation's best dishes and creates new recipes. In the first episode, Tom travels up the Northern California coastline, where he cooks a nori steamed pollock with a beurre blanc and beachcombs.

programme.title: Tom Kerridge's American Feast
programme.desc: Tom Kerridge travels to Oakland in California, where he cooks a spiced pumpkin pie and learns to prepare traditional northern noodles.

programme.title: Donal's Asian Baking Adventure
programme.desc: In Macau, Donal Skehan gets up early to bag a box of popular local treat, Lord Stow's egg tarts. He also bakes Macanese almond biscuits and creme brulee tart.

programme.title: Donal's Asian Baking Adventure
programme.desc: In Seoul, Donal Skehan visits the Glamorous Penguin Cafe run by Sophia Yoo, who bakes European-style cakes with a Korean twist. Later, he makes Korean dumplings.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The remaining contestants' pie-making skills are put to the test in a trio of demanding tasks. First, the hopefuls try to impress judges Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry by making beef Wellington, before creating hand-raised pies during this round's technical challenge - but several of the cooks run into difficulties as they try to work with a pastry dolly for the first time. Finally, the showstopper challenge sees traditional American pies being prepared - before one more baker is eliminated from the competition. From 2012.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The pressure continues to rise as the contestants' pudding-making skills face a stern examination. Their first task involves creating a pair of sponge dishes, before Mary Berry sets the latest technical challenge - recreating her recipe for the meringue-topped dessert queen of puddings. Finally the cooks try to get to grips with the intricacies of baking strudel in the showstopper round - before one of them leaves the competition for good. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins. From 2012.

programme.title: James Martin's American Adventure
programme.desc: The chef visits Louisiana, cooks in the historic Houmas House, and samples local speciality gumbo, courtesy of the resident cook. He is also taken on a ghost tour to find out about people who once worked on the property.

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.sub-title: Green Tea Salmon and Modern Greek Salad
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates how to prepare green tea salmon, coconut rice and miso greens, as well as modern Greek salad with spinach, chickpea and feta parcels, all within the space of 15 minutes.

programme.title: Jamie's 30 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver presents a step-by-step guide to preparing jerk chicken with rice and beans, chopped salad and chargrilled corn, all in half an hour.

programme.title: Delicious Miss Brown
programme.desc: Kardea makes updated versions of favourite foods from her childhood. They include yummy double berry snack bars and mini golden beef pockets.

programme.title: Delicious Miss Brown
programme.desc: Kardea treats her mum and aunt to a spa day followed by a decadent dinner. She makes creamy lobster and corn pappardelle and chocolate martinis.

programme.title: Be My Guest with Ina Garten
programme.desc: Ina Garten welcomes award-winning singer and actress Faith Hill with frozen paloma cocktails and guacamole. Later, they bake Coca-Cola cake with Faith's daughter.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond shares great chicken recipes from the ranch. They include spatchcock chicken sheet pan supper, fabulous peach whisky chicken, and a chicken kale Caesar salad kit.

programme.title: Ainsley Eats The Streets
programme.desc: In Madrid, Ainsley is on a mission to discover how and where the locals eat. Later, he visits the city's first-ever street food festival.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The 10 remaining contestants face three tasks designed to test their bread-making skills, beginning by creating 12 perfect rye bread rolls shaped in any way they like and using as much flour as they dare. For the technical challenge they have to prepare Italian ciabatta using Paul's recipe, before ending with show-stopping centrepiece loaves that will have to make an impact on the table as well as on the judges. Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry then decide which of the contenders will be the week's star baker - and which of them is going home. Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins present.

programme.title: James Martin's American Adventure
programme.desc: The chef heads towards Louisiana's swamplands, where he ditches his car for a high-speed boat. Then, he travels to the nearby city of Lafayette, where he visits the family run smokehouse, Johnson's Boucaniere, and samples some of their traditional homemade sausage. James also tries ice cream from the legendary Borden's ice cream parlour, before heading back to the swamps to cook one final dish.

programme.title: Tom Kerridge's American Feast

programme.title: Restaurant: Impossible
programme.desc: Robert is called to J's Restaurant in Waveland, Mississippi. He helps owners Louis and Jeff rescue their business and save their lifelong friendship.

programme.title: Fantasy Homes by the Sea
programme.desc: Newly married couple Peter and Anne plan to move to south Devon, with a budget of £1.2 million to buy a detached coastal home with sea views, room for chickens and goats and a separate annexe for Anne's physiotherapy practice.

programme.title: Building Off the Grid
programme.desc: In North Pole, Alaska, the mayor builds a remote family cabin about 16-miles from the nearest town. The harsh cold conditions and location are a big challenge.

programme.title: Restoration Home
programme.desc: Caroline Quentin meets Graham and Nicola, who bought a 17th-century barn near Norwich in the hope of transforming the cathedral-sized building into a family home. When builder Graham takes on the massive task of restoring the roof himself, he discovers it is being supported by just one rotten beam, and as he battles to save it, the historical investigation throws up a surprise link to a famous architect.

programme.title: My Lottery Dream Home
programme.desc: A Wisconsinite is ready to ditch her tiny apartment after winning $500,000. David Bromstad helps her find a home with space to entertain friends and family.

programme.title: My Lottery Dream Home
programme.desc: An avid gambler won $500,000 on the lottery and is ready to hunt for a house with David Bromstad. She wants a fixer-upper so she can put her own stamp on the home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping

programme.title: Building Off the Grid
programme.desc: Chris and Catelyn Williams are building a luxury yurt with mountain views and modern amenities in Montana. Features include solar power, kitchen and hot running water.

programme.title: The Great Interior Design Challenge
programme.desc: It's the semi-final, where three designers try and secure their place in the grand final. The challenge they have to conquer in order to get there is redesigning a sitting room each on a medieval terrace in the Cathedral city of Wells, in Somerset. Judging them are Sophie Robinson and Daniel Hopwood, but for this semi-final decision they have invited along another guest judge - designer and entrepreneur Orla Kiely. Tom Dyckhoff presents.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Tamsin is looking for her dream holiday home on the Greek island of Crete. She and her best friend Emma, who she has known since meeting at nursery school, have enjoyed many a holiday on the island, and now Tamsin is ready to have her own bolthole there. Laura Hamilton works within her budget of £100,000 to find a suitable property.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A pair of property hunters search for a rural home to accommodate their extended family in the Wiltshire countryside. Meanwhile, presenter Nicki Chapman learns about Salisbury Cathedral's restoration project.

programme.title: Fantasy Homes by the Sea
programme.desc: B&B hosts Kay and Andy are looking to upscale their hospitality business by setting up a larger and grander version on the heritage coast of Snowdonia.

programme.title: My Lottery Dream Home
programme.desc: A Florida couple receives a $900,000 inheritance from a long-lost relative. David Bromstad steps in to help them find a mountain vacation home in Georgia.

programme.title: My Lottery Dream Home
programme.desc: David Bromstad heads to Texas to meet a couple who won the lottery. The pair have construction and inspection experience, so they keep David busy.

programme.title: Home Town
programme.sub-title: Home is Where the Art is
programme.desc: An artist wants to buy a home with an art studio near family and friends. She has a budget of $200,000 and Erin helps her adds a series of bold colours to the house.

programme.title: Bargain Block
programme.desc: Keith and Evan work with minimalism in a rundown bungalow while letting loose with pink decor in the Modern Dollhouse.

programme.title: The Great Interior Design Challenge

programme.title: Restoration Home
programme.desc: Geri and her husband Kevin bought an 18th-century property in Devon after falling for its gothic arches, quirky architectural features and a glass lantern-like cupola, but discovered it was in a critical condition. The expected budget for repairs quickly doubles and Geri has to take over management of the build herself - but then the true impact of trying to undo more than 200 years of amateur construction hits home. Caroline Quentin presents.

programme.desc: B&B hosts Kay and Andy are looking to upscale their hospitality business by setting up a larger and grander version on the heritage coast of Snowdonia.

programme.title: My Lottery Dream Home
programme.desc: A Florida couple receives a $900,000 inheritance from a long-lost relative. David Bromstad steps in to help them find a mountain vacation home in Georgia.

programme.title: My Lottery Dream Home
programme.desc: David Bromstad heads to Texas to meet a couple who won the lottery. The pair have construction and inspection experience, so they keep David busy.

programme.title: Home Town
programme.sub-title: Home is Where the Art is
programme.desc: An artist wants to buy a home with an art studio near family and friends. She has a budget of $200,000 and Erin helps her adds a series of bold colours to the house.

programme.title: Bargain Block
programme.desc: Keith and Evan work with minimalism in a rundown bungalow while letting loose with pink decor in the Modern Dollhouse.

programme.title: The Great Interior Design Challenge
programme.desc: It's the semi-final, where three designers try and secure their place in the grand final. The challenge they have to conquer in order to get there is redesigning a sitting room each on a medieval terrace in the Cathedral city of Wells, in Somerset. Judging them are Sophie Robinson and Daniel Hopwood, but for this semi-final decision they have invited along another guest judge - designer and entrepreneur Orla Kiely. Tom Dyckhoff presents.

programme.title: Restoration Home
programme.desc: Geri and her husband Kevin bought an 18th-century property in Devon after falling for its gothic arches, quirky architectural features and a glass lantern-like cupola, but discovered it was in a critical condition. The expected budget for repairs quickly doubles and Geri has to take over management of the build herself - but then the true impact of trying to undo more than 200 years of amateur construction hits home. Caroline Quentin presents.

programme.title: Building Off the Grid
programme.desc: Chris and Catelyn Williams are building a luxury yurt with mountain views and modern amenities in Montana. Features include solar power, kitchen and hot running water.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Tamsin is looking for her dream holiday home on the Greek island of Crete. She and her best friend Emma, who she has known since meeting at nursery school, have enjoyed many a holiday on the island, and now Tamsin is ready to have her own bolthole there. Laura Hamilton works within her budget of £100,000 to find a suitable property.

programme.title: Countess Dracula (1971)
programme.desc: A Hungarian countess discovers bathing in the blood of virgins is the secret of eternal youth, and demands her lover bring her a steady stream of victims. However, her affair with another man turns him against her, while the spate of disappearing young women arouses suspicion. Hammer horror, starring Ingrid Pitt, Nigel Green and Lesley-Anne Down.

programme.title: Final Girl (2015)
programme.desc: Four sadistic teenage boys trick girls into coming into a forest with them, so they can hunt and kill them for sport. However, they do not realise that their latest intended victim is an aspiring assassin, who has to kill them all to complete her training. Thriller, starring Abigail Breslin and Alexander Ludwig.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance for viewers to purchase goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance for viewers to purchase goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: Adventure with the modern-day lawman whose crime-solving methods are rooted firmly in the Old West. Chuck Norris stars.

programme.title: Mutant X
programme.desc: The team help the crew of an ocean research station threatened by a prehistoric creature - previously thought to be extinct. Sci-fi drama, starring John Shea, Victor Webster, Victoria Pratt and Forbes March.

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: The Enterprise's efforts to communicate with an incomprehensible alien race result in Picard and his opposite number being stranded on a nearby planet, where they confront a deadly threat. Sci-fi drama, with Patrick Stewart.

programme.title: Megaconda (2010)
programme.desc: When unexpected volcanic activity awakens a huge prehistoric snake, a sheriff and his team race against time to stop its trail of destruction. Horror thriller, starring Dylan Vox, Michelle Bauer and Matthew Chandler.

programme.title: Legend Lowdown
programme.desc: Take a look at all the latest movies and series coming your way this month.

programme.title: Megalodon (2018)
programme.desc: A military vessel searching for a mysterious submersible finds itself fighting off a lethal giant shark. Action adventure, starring Michael Madsen, Aimee Stolte and Paulina Laurant.

programme.title: Legend Lowdown
programme.desc: Take a look at all the latest movies and series coming your way this month.

programme.title: Biggles: Adventure In Time (1986)
programme.desc: A New York businessman is mysteriously transported back in time to the First World War, where he meets the famed British flying ace Biggles. The time traveller discovers he has been sent back to help the daredevil pilot destroy a German secret weapon that could change the course of history. Sci-fi adventure, starring Neil Dickson, Alex Hyde-White and Peter Cushing in his final film role.

credits.actor: Peter Cushing in his final film role

programme.title: Legend Lowdown
programme.desc: Take a look at all the latest movies and series coming your way this month.

programme.title: Star Trek
programme.desc: Kirk and Spock beam down to an asylum for the criminally insane to deliver medical supplies, but run into trouble when they are taken prisoner by an inmate with the power to assume any shape. William Shatner and Leonard Nimoy star.

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Picard is compelled to accept a stubborn officer's assistance in tracking down a Bajoran terrorist leader blamed for an attack on a Federation colony - but soon discovers his superiors have a hidden agenda. Guest starring Whoopi Goldberg and Michelle Forbes.

programme.title: Airwolf
programme.sub-title: Where Have All the Children Gone?
programme.desc: Hawke is asked to deliver a medal of honour to one of his friends - but it is not long before he runs into trouble. Jan-Michael Vincent stars.

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: Part one of two. Walker helps a man come to terms with his past in order to carry on his father's legacy. Wilma Knight makes a cameo appearance alongside son Chuck Norris.

programme.title: The Lawnmower Man (1992)
programme.desc: A scientist's ill-advised experiments with virtual reality equipment transform a mentally handicapped gardener into a computer-enhanced megalomaniac with the power to make his dreams of world domination come true. Sci-fi thriller, starring Pierce Brosnan, Jeff Fahey, Jenny Wright, Geoffrey Lewis and Austin O'Brien.

programme.title: Western World (2017)
programme.desc: A US Marshal is sent to the town of Dogwood Pass to catch a ruthless killer, where a corrupt mayor and an unhinged sheriff stand in the way of justice. Western, starring Brian Spangler and Darrell P Miller.

programme.desc: The host presents his unmissable verdict on the day's global events with an hour of fearless debate, straight-talking interviews with the world's leading figures, and plenty of fun.

programme.title: Buster (1988)
programme.desc: Fact-based crime drama about the life of Buster Edwards, a member of the gang responsible for the Great Train Robbery. Going on the run after the notorious heist, he flees to Mexico with his family. However, his homesick wife struggles to adapt to her new life, leaving the outlaw with a difficult choice. Starring Phil Collins, Julie Walters, Sheila Hancock, Larry Lamb and Ralph Brown.

programme.title: The Hidden City
programme.desc: Luther and Vince plot to rescue Lucy.

programme.title: Quest Boxing League
programme.desc: Welcome to the UK's toughest boxing competition, where aspiring young boxers battle it out inside the ring for their chance to be crowned the Quest Boxing League Champion.

programme.title: Phaedra (1962)
programme.desc: A Greek shipping magnate marries a younger woman, and sends her to London to bring his estranged son home. The young man begins a passionate affair with his stepmother, but is consumed with guilt for betraying his father. When she learns her husband's plans for his son, she reveals the truth, setting in motion a tragic confrontation. Drama, starring Melina Mercouri and Anthony Perkins.

programme.title: Roswell Conspiracies
programme.desc: The story of allied intelligence agents who've discovered aliens on Earth who are bent on taking over the world. In response, the agents form a top-secret multinational agency, The Global Alliance.

programme.title: Dork Hunters from Outer Space
programme.desc: Alien Dorks disguise themselves as humans to use Earth as a base to take over the universe, but they face opposition from some unlikely teenage heroes.

programme.title: Pocket Dragon Adventures
programme.desc: A group of very small dragons live with a kindly old wizard, they're not big enough to fly but that doesn't stop them having many adventures.

programme.title: Extreme Dinosaurs
programme.desc: 65 Million years ago, Dinosaurs disappeared. Now they're Back! T-Bone, Spike, Bullzeye, and Stegz. Four prehistoric dinosaurs, evolved into intelligent beings reawaken in a bizarre new world.

programme.title: Stone Age
programme.sub-title: Between a Little Rock and a Big Hard Place
programme.desc: Meet a group of typical suburban nine-year-old kids with friends, foes and families kicking it really old school, in prehistoric times..

programme.title: Stone Age
programme.desc: Meet a group of typical suburban nine-year-old kids with friends, foes and families kicking it really old school, in prehistoric times..

programme.title: Legend of the Dragon
programme.desc: The guardian of the temple has passed on and a new Golden Dragon must be Chosen from a brother and sister - Twins born in the Year of the Dragon. Only one will be chosen. Their sibling bond tested.

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: Representatives from a dying planet meet members of the Moonbase Alpha crew, and offer some of them a chance to return to Earth. Sci-fi adventure, starring Martin Landau and Barbara Bain.

programme.title: The Baron
programme.desc: A woman who witnesses gangsters disposing of a body flees in terror. Mannering is enlisted to track her down and obtain her statement.

programme.title: Little Matters: Turtles
programme.desc: Turtles are slow, calm, gentle creatures - but not always.

programme.title: Coastal Railways with Julie Walters
programme.desc: The actress travels from Cardigan Bay to Liverpool, visiting the heritage railway in Tywyn that was the inspiration for Thomas the Tank Engine and a community that is famous for knitting. She also paints a carriage in Boston Lodge, catches the famous Ffestiniog railway through Snowdonia, and visits Europe's fastest zip wire and largest pet cemetery.

programme.title: The Devil's Disciple (1959)
programme.desc: The black sheep of a family is befriended by a minister. A case of mistaken identity leads both men to discover their true vocations during the American War of Independence. Historical drama based on George Bernard Shaw's play, starring Burt Lancaster, Kirk Douglas and Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The Best Man (1964)
programme.desc: Presidential candidates resort to smear tactics to have their party nominated at election time. Gore Vidal's political drama, starring Henry Fonda, Cliff Robertson, Margaret Leighton and Shelly Berman.

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay.

programme.title: Cat Hospital
programme.desc: A stray cat has been re-named Apple, but still needs a permanent home. Binky is one of the most seriously ill cats that Clare has met and 10-year-old Sparky has terminal cancer, prompting the vets to consider a homeopath potion.

programme.title: Danger Dogs
programme.desc: Documentary following dogs and their trainers as they are put through their paces in everything from sniffing out drugs to finding roadside bombs in conflict zones.

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London.

programme.title: Shine On Harvey Moon
programme.desc: An RAF clerk returns from the war to find his house in ruins - destroyed not by German bombs, but by his wife forgetting to turn off the gas.

programme.title: Plane Crash Recreated
programme.desc: First-hand accounts of the disaster that befell United Airlines Flight 232, which was making its way from Denver to Chicago in 1989 when the DC-10 aircraft suffered a catastrophic failure to the tail-engine.

programme.title: The Hidden City
programme.desc: Lucy has some surprising news for Vince.

programme.title: Nutcracker (1982)
programme.desc: A Russian ballerina defects to the West, and is drawn into a web of intrigue when she joins a London company run by a powerful, possessive woman. Drama, starring Joan Collins, Paul Nicholas and Finola Hughes.

programme.title: Mysterious Creatures (2006)
programme.desc: Fact-based drama, starring Timothy Spall and Brenda Blethyn as the parents of a woman with mental health difficulties. When their daughter's hostile behaviour and the authorities' lack of support become too much to handle, the couple decide to commit suicide together, writing a letter to a local newspaper to explain the reasons behind their actions. The cast also includes Rebekah Staton and Judy Flynn.

credits.actor: Brenda Blethyn as the parents of a woman

programme.title: Late Night Magic
programme.desc: It may be late but you can rely on Magic to keep you company all night long with nothing but our greatest hits.

programme.title: Brighten Up Your Breakfast!
programme.desc: Let us brighten up your morning with some of our favourite feel-good songs!.

programme.title: Louise's Girls Gone Solo
programme.desc: Louise Redknapp leads the charge of ladies who started off in bands, and later dared to go it alone! Relive all the 90s and noughties bangers from Shazney to Beyonce.

programme.title: Girl Power! It's Women's Day
programme.desc: In celebration of International Women's Day join us for some girl power.

programme.title: Kimberley Walsh: Girl Bands Aloud!
programme.desc: From TLC right through to Little Mix, Girls Aloud's Kimberley Walsh presses play on all the biggest and best girl bands of the last few decades.

programme.title: Girl Power! It's Women's Day
programme.desc: In celebration of International Women's Day join us for some girl power.

programme.title: Natalie Imbruglia's Female History
programme.desc: Natalie Imbruglia has hand selected some of the greatest female hits of the last two decades. Expect Torn, Juice, New Rules & many more.

programme.title: Girl Power! It's Women's Day
programme.desc: In celebration of International Women's Day join us for some girl power.

programme.title: Cassette Mixtape: The Girls
programme.desc: Join Magic FM Presenter Kat Shoob as she guides you through her mixtape full of hits from some of her favourite women in music! Kylie, Whitney, Madonna and Kate Bush all feature..

programme.title: Forgotten Faves: Girlband Hits
programme.desc: Magic helps you rediscover the Girlband hits you forgot you loved. How many will you remember?.

programme.title: Girl Power! It's Women's Day
programme.desc: In celebration of International Women's Day join us for some girl power.

programme.title: Home Greek Home
programme.desc: With building works banned and builders doubling as speedboat drivers in the summer, Sara's build is under pressure with just five weeks till the Greek tourist season begins.

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr, Sean Lock and Jon Richardson are joined by Bob Mortimer and Holly Walsh for more comic innuendos and unpredictable conundrums. Claudia Winkleman stands in for Rachel Riley on letters-and-numbers duty, while Isy Suttie is in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent is in Dictionary Corner.

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Betting shop owner Les, 40, is rushed to St George's after losing control of his car on a country road on his way to work. Cambelle, a 21-year-old plumber, has an infected cyst that may require surgery, while 67-year-old retired doctor Patrick is brought to A&E following a horse-riding accident in which he was dragged 130ft and not found for more than two hours.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Communications director Kath and graphic designer Charlotte from east London cannot wait to escape their busy city lives by buying a Spanish holiday home around the stunning mountains of the Sierra Nevada, where it's possible to sunbathe on the beach and go skiing, all in the same day. Danni Menzies finds five options for their £120,000 budget, but will any wow them enough to want to put in an offer?.

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty visits Mauritius to find out about white and dark rum and learns where the term 'proof' originally came from in relation to alcohol.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Joe and Emma from Kent have been married for 21 years. After years of holidaying in Spain, they've decided to sell up in the UK and make a permanent move along with their daughter Gracie to Spain's Mar Menor. Armed with a budget of £90,000, Ben Hillman sets out to find the pair the perfect property.

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: Glampsite owners in Portugal face the reality of living off-grid, and at a horse riding centre in France, cameras follow a mother and daughter with grand plans.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry and Simon head to Pembrokeshire to meet mechanic James, whose family have a stack of sheds crammed with classic cars, motorbikes and tractors, including a 1928 Model A Ford.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to Suffolk to meet friends John and Jane who have been collecting and swapping items for many years.

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The search for relatives of an east London lady reveals a connection to arguably the most famous heist of the 20th century, and one heir hunter takes on larger firms in Cheshire.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Inn at the Park in Aberdeen, where for owners Ronnie and Steph Caird, it's all about keeping it in the family. When the guests arrive, design-conscious father and son Steve and Allard take a trip back in time, and John isn't flushed with praise for his bathroom. At dinner, John reveals his culinary background, piling on the pressure for Ronnie to deliver a good breakfast. Fiona and Shauna's sizeable confession raises eyebrows, while in the morning, Ronnie has a breakfast to forget and the bathroom blues leave Ronnie and Steph seeking answers from their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Ingliston Country Club in Renfrewshire, where events manager Shauna Kirk and sales manager Fiona Gallagher prove a force to be reckoned with. Guests Steve and Allard aren't feeling the dated décor, and John proves that one size doesn't fit all. Ronnie and Steph are blown away by the competition, but they think that perfection comes at a price.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit, the group heads to 1692 Wasdale in the Lake District, where owners Steve and Allard Newell have proudly built their B&B from the ground up.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests stay at the Lynbar Hotel in Blackpool, where Ronnie and Steph have parking problems, while confident owner John O'Donnell boasts of serving the best breakfast in town.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to settle some scores. Inn at the Park owners Ronnie and Steph Caird are intent on clearing up John's issues with the toilet.

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer are house hunting in Essex and East London. Kirstie is searching for grandmother Janet, who is looking for a future-proof home where she will be able to live comfortably in the years to come. Meanwhile, Phil meets first-time buyers Adam and Becky, who are struggling to find a place to start a family.

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet a couple Jamie Lea and Curtis in Albrighton in Shropshire who are unsure whether they should renovate their current home or sell up and move into another. Jamie Lea wants to settle down and enjoy family life in their three-bed terrace, but Curtis wants a bigger house with a better garden in the countryside for their growing family.

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: Angel sets about restoring the Chateau's walls to their original glory using computer mock-ups to try and match the existing colour. Part of a traditional device used for making cider is discovered while clearing out the piggery, so the hunt is soon on to locate the rest of it. Inspired by the ancient piece of machinery, the family collects apples to make their very own juice.

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets architect and shed fanatic Micah Jones, who plans to transform an old agricultural building in Co Down. Micah plans an upside-down, four-bedroom shed using new techniques and materials, but the £200,000 budget runs short and Micah is forced to take on some of the building work himself.

programme.title: Falklands War: The Untold Story
programme.desc: Documentary examining the Falklands conflict 40 years on. The head of the SAS in the Falklands, Sir Michael Rose, speaks publicly for the first time about the war, and how the British task force came close to defeat. Plus, ground troops and senior commanders, many for the first time, reveal how an unexpected change in the plan for the land campaign nearly cost Britain the war, and led to unnecessary loss of life at the iconic Battle of Goose Green, and in the sinking of the Sir Galahad.

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Cora, 62, arrives by air ambulance following a high-speed road accident, which left her trapped in the car for more than an hour. Her husband Rae, 65, who was driving, is brought in soon after, and staff are concerned he may have sustained serious head, neck and internal injuries. Scott, 23, has badly cut his knee after a night out, and while he's being treated, he reflects on his schizophrenia diagnosis as a teenager. Retired carpenter Richard, 68, has fallen and hit his head on the pavement, but medics also want to look into his unusually low blood pressure.

programme.title: Billion Pound Cruise
programme.desc: Daily life on the mammoth cruise ship the Symphony of the Seas, revealing how some of the 6,680 guests occupy themselves on board this billion-pound vessel that's full of surprises.

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: West Midlands paramedics and the air ambulance rush to save an elderly man who has life-changing injuries following a fall from a ladder. At the same time in Birmingham, a newly qualified paramedic struggles to treat a man who has had three major epileptic fits and is in a delirious and combative state. In Coventry, paramedics Neil Vann and Laura Perkins help a young girl who has passed out and needs urgent medical attention.

programme.title: Home Greek Home
programme.desc: With building works banned and builders doubling as speedboat drivers in the summer, Sara's build is under pressure with just five weeks till the Greek tourist season begins.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike finds a rare, rally-bred 1972 Lancia Fulvia. He and Ant must fix its bad CV joints, a broken heater, cracked dash and a debris-clogged fuel system.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Following an ANPR ping, Stu assists with an armed vehicle stop believed to be connected to a firearms incident in Gloucester. PC Parkes visits a woman who failed to hand herself in.

programme.title: Goblin Works Garage
programme.desc: When a Ford Capri rolls into the garage, the Goblin team add a 5 litre, 2017 Mustang engine. Meanwhile, Ant and Helen are getting a tattoo.

programme.title: Richard Hammond's Workshop
programme.desc: Richard opens a classic car restoration workshop, but being the boss of a new business isn't quite what he expected, so he ropes in his family to help promote it.

programme.desc: A bride who hates trying on dresses in shops buys 10 gowns online instead - but finds she does not like any of them.

programme.desc: A bride is unhappy with the train on her dress, and Jo and Al have very little time to put things right.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Singer Boy George knows that his maternal grandmother was found wandering the streets of Dublin as a small child and put in a children's home, and also heard that one of his great uncles was hanged in Dublin's Mountjoy jail and is somehow connected to Kevin Barry, who was commemorated in an Irish rebel song. As George uncovers the grim details of what really happened to his grandmother and his great uncle, he also delights in a new sense of his family being truly part of Irish history.

programme.title: Dr Pimple Popper

programme.desc: In July 2010, NBA star Lorenzen Wright went missing outside of Memphis. When his dead body was discovered in woods, investigators struggled to find what had happened.
